awd_titl_txt: Equipment Needs to Support Undergraduate Instruction in     Human Machine Systems Engineering
awd_abstract_narration: Students in the Systems Engineering Laboratory of the North                     Carolina A & T State University are learning human-machine                      interaction principles, as part of their industrial engineering                 education, using a teleoperated robot.  Working in a human-                     machine interaction environment is a newly accepted paradigm,                   shifting from manual-supervisory to cognitive-supervisory tasks                 involving the complexity of the human-machine interface.  This                  laboratory allows the incorporation of modern technologies                      associated with human-machine systems in a modern industrial                    engineering curriculum.  Among those, the laboratory (1)                        exposes the graduate and undergraduate students to a human-                     machine environment that supports modern engineering design                     theories, (2) provides the students with an environment to                      experiment with multi-agent systems (robots, computers,                         cameras, human operators, etc.), and (3) improves quality of                    instruction in a cost/effective manner by providing resources                   for student projects and direct laboratory case studies.

inst.inst_name: North Carolina Agricultural & Technical State University
